d.Name: Integration Flow Design Guidelines - Use the Partner Directory Appropriately
d.Description:
The Partner Directory is used in integration scenarios where you establish a communication network between many communication partners. In such kind of scenarios, you build one or a few integration flows which are parametrized by partner-specific information. The parametrized components in the integration flow read the partner-specific information from the Partner Directory. The Partner Directory contains for each partner parameters, like

  • the Authorized User which is authorized to call inbound endpoints of the integration flow(s),
  • the HTTP addresses needed for making outbound calls to the partner systems.

With the Partner Directory, it is possible to add new communication partners without downtime and without changing or redeploying the integration flows. The tenant administrator or Partner Directory configurator can enter entries of a new partner into the Partner Directory via an OData API while the message processing for the existing partners is ongoing.

Check out the SAP Help Portal for a description of the Partner Directory capabilities.

Get a detailed description of the Partner Directory API on SAP API Business Hub.

 

In the Documents section you will find some useful Postman Collections.

Advantages of using these collections and the environment structure are as follows:

  • Switch easily between tenants, you can use the same environment for both postman collections.
  • A standardized and easy way to use CSRF token for the APIs that use POST, PUT, DELETE methods.

Getting Started

  • Download the postman collections and the postman environment files
  • Import the postman collections (import button on the top-left corner) and the postman environment (environment settings on the top-right corner)
  • Duplicate the environment template for each SAP Cloud Integration tenant you use (and rename collections accordingly) and enter the specific tenant details
  • Choose the environment you defined earlier and start using collections
  • Before you do any operation you need to fetch a CSRF token. Call Get CSRF request once before using e.g. POST methods in the collections

This documentation explains how to work with the Postman collection attached to this integration package in general.

More details on the guidelines covered in this integration package can be found on SAP Help Portal.
d.ShortText: This integration package contains integration flows to illustrate the design guidelines for Partner Directory. More details can be found on SAP Help Portal.
